decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 2085 -03/FP received on 25th February 2011  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwellinghouse.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and in the interests of the character and appearance of the Conservation Area, in accordance with Policies 4.1, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  REASON: To protect he living conditions of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with  Policy 4.11 of the Adopted UDP (2004). | The use hereby permitted shall not operate outside the hours of 0800 -2300hrs Sunday to Thursday and 0800 - 1200hrs on Fridays and Saturdays.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'The New Plan for the Environment' (2004) Policies 4.4 and 4.11. | Within three months of the date of the permission hereby granted, details of the installation, operation, and maintenance of the best practicable odour abatement equipment including an extract system, the height of the discharge, and the efflux velocity of the effluent at the point of discharge shall be submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority. Thereafter these details once approved shall be fully implemented within three months and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.  REASON: To protect he living conditions of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with  Policy 4.11 of the Adopted UDP (2004).
description: Retrospective change of use to mixed use Restaurant (A3) and Take Away (A5), along with the erection of a new wall and insertion of a door in rear elevation.
